results.title: The Southern Cloud
results.creator_credit: Cleve Maher and Lions Club of Cooma
results.brief_description: Briefly covers the arrival of Charles Kingsford-Smith and C.T.P. Ulm in Australia after their trans-Pacific flight and the formation of the original Australian National Airways that commenced services in 1931. The Southern Cloud was lost in 1931 until its wreckage was discovered in 1958. Narration by James Dibble.

results.title: The South seas
results.creator_credit: Peter Teneyck and Video Trip Corporation
results.brief_description: A tour through the island paradises of the South Seas, including Tahiti, Moorea Island, Bora Bora, and Fiji. As a bonus there are tips on travel, accommodation, climate and food.

results.title: The Sounds of Aus: The Story of the Aussie Accent
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Princess Pictures, Lawrie Zion, David Swann and Yael Bergman
results.brief_description:
The Australian accent has long been regarded as the most significant identifier of our cultural DNA and is arguably the most Australian thing about us. ‘The Sounds of Aus’ tells the story of the Australian accent, how it came about, how it has evolved over two hundred years of colonial and cultural history and how it is used in contemporary Australia. The accent reveals much about our identity, as individuals, as communities and as a nation. The Aussie accent has regularly been the battleground over which conflicts on identity have played out.
Presented with dry irony by raconteur John Clarke, ‘The Sounds of Aus’ debunks many common myths about the accent as we hear from a wide range of experts, from dialect coach Victoria Mielewska, phonetician Dr Felicity Cox, Oxford Dictionary editor Bruce Moore, and historians Michael Cathcart and Joy Damousi, to actors, comedians, and media performers such as; Rachel Griffiths, Bert Newton, Denise Scott, Santo Cilauro, Akmal Saleh, Max Gillies, Barry Crocker, Mary-Anne Fahey, and film director Bruce Beresford.

results.title: The Sound of music (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Robert Wise, Argyle and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The Sound of music, the most popular movie musical of all time, is a heart warming, inspirational and true story based on the lives of the Trapp Family Singers. Julie Andrews is Maria, a spirited, young Austrian woman who becomes governess to the children of the autocratic widower Baron von Trapp (Christopher Plummer). She brings warmth and music to the strict household of the reserved former naval captain, and soon wins over the children - and finally the baron as well.

results.title: The Sound collector
results.creator_credit: Lynn Smith, David Verrall, Ishu Patel and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The Sound Collector, an animation film that uses a combination of collage, paper cut-outs and colored inks on glass, features Leonard, a six-year-old with an unusual hobby. He collects sounds. Transforming household noises around him into exciting fantasies, he creates an adventure story for his scornful older brother in which knights in armor chase away monsters and perform other daring deeds. This film that will entertain young and old alike lends itself to a variety of classroom uses, to encourage creativity in children, and to stimulate discussion on topics such as individuality, family relationships, and imagination.
